replies.body:
Good luck finding a support while everyone queues up as top or mid.

But seriously, comparing queue times in team builder (finding a support takes forever, queuing up as a support takes seconds) is noticable enough that I think *ranked team builder is a bad idea.* The point of ranked is competitive TEAM play, meaning your skills should be tested in teamwork as well as mechanics. This will just encourage complacency, turning people who say "Last pick? But I can't support!" from liars to people who *really *can't support. And, uh, other roles too.
*cough cough* support main *cough*
Same here. It saddens me to see teams get all excited when they finally find a support after waiting so long. :I

How to be a total d-bag:
1. Play teambuilder support.
2. Be extremely picky with teamcomp.
3. ???
4. Profit

The irony is that this actually works really well.
Since your queue times are measured in seconds, you can just hop from team to team until you get the best comp.
haha, hahhaa. okay yeah i do this.

> [{quoted}](name=tombdragon,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=IBvfMfoi,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-02-23T09:49:44.975+0000)
>
> Good luck finding a support while everyone queues up as top or mid.
> 

Good luck learning how to do support lissandra/riven/rumble/gnar/syndra/zed/etc.

I mean, support's not really a crippled role. The support is easily the most powerful person on the team and the person who contributes the most to a victory. You wanna win, don't you? Get out there and learn support Evelynn!

(Although I feel ya man. Walking into any game and having someone else call your role or champ is a downer. It's even more awkward when you're duo-queueing and another pair of players call your two roles, and then you have to play something else, while someone is learning the ropes - team builder is nice but it has its own problems. It'll have some rough patches for quite a while.)

I personally (and respectfully) beg to differ. When I support, I end up being incredibly poor compared to my teammates, regardless of how well we do.  And if I kill a minion when the carry is anywhere in the vicinity, I end up having to hide in a bomb shelter to survive the rage.
I am also convinced that the support is really a team scapegoat. If the carry is at 5% health but tower dives anyway, who is to blame? The support! Who else?
If I support, I make set ground rules before I pick my champion, because who wants to support while all of the above is true?

I understand completely. That's why I talked to my doctor about "Duo-queue."

There are a few side effects, namely the lack of ability to blame bad plays on lag, having to listen to other people on voice chat, and having to socialize.
You should talk to your doctor, and see if Duo-queue is right for you.

I'm a support/jungler main, I'm just poking fun at how ridiculous the difference between supply/demand is. Supports are gamechangers, something not a lot of people realize. A well-timed Lulu ult, Braum ult, whatever can change the course of the fight. Not to mention the combos possible.

First time I learned that Lulu's ult could combo, it resulted in Highlander Master Yi scoring a pentakill IMMEDIATELY. Then I did it during a J4 ult and it was EPIC.

Man, people should really try supports instead of focusing on damage. And buy a ward too, sightstone is not a replacement for a team's warding.

I tried Annie support just yesterday and was like "holy crap, I'm scarier than any mid laner!"
Supports are very seriously underrated. :)

I haven't tried that for one reason:

I had one support me during a ranked game, and the end result gave me nightmares.

I would never inflict that terror on my enemies.

I agree with this. The biggest deterrent for me is the added queue times. The next thing I really dislike is the ability to climb the ladder in one role. If it is implemented in such a way that queue times are comparable to live I can tolerate the 2nd thing that bothers me. However if it is the other way around I think it is a step backward.

If what you say is true, where in the world are you playing ranked, because here in NA when you are top three picks and take mid, someone from the last two picks also goes mid. Saying whatever guys i called mid and i cant support so mid it is. then you either have duo mid, no jg, triple bot lane, double, adc, etc, etc. Where ever you play is a far off magical world, or a dream. One that people try and fill all the rolls of the "TEAM" and also pick decent champs for the roll, unlike viktor support or katarina top and wonder how they lose to darius/garen.

But only two people at most pick a role at the same time...

People usually respect pick order to a point. I'm not saying people are saints, but people usually say what role they want, and have a brief discussion if two people want the same thing. Never seen any big drama about it.

I'm not sure if it's intended, but your response comes off as slightly condescending. I don't live in a "magical world" where everything falls into place, I'm just said that ranked team builder is a bad idea (in my *opinion*) because ranked play is about teamwork. You've ever seen a Bronze game where the losing team has that one guy screaming "omg why do I get the bad teams?" There's a common denominator, and it is not their mechanics. 

So yeah, you're going to get games where people troll or break the meta by going duo mid/top/whatever, but you're going to get games where people suck it up and do what's best for the team (or you get a team where everyone just so happens to be proficient, not necessarily a main, in enough roles to get a solid team composition).

I cant say i agree with you at all, because i never get those players who suck it up and take the out cast role. ive spent money in game to try and be that guy to take what nobody wants. In the end i lost 14 games in ranked in a row, won one, lost a dozen more, the elo slide is too real. Now I am bronze fully admit it. My original placement games i played jg and support to make my silver/gold matched teammates happy, it doesn't matter at that level though, someone is going to feed and i play the two most blamed roles in the game. 

Nobody want to be the bigger person and play the shitty roles, everyone wants to be a star, carry and do it with what ever champion they want, in what ever lane they want. Like yi mid against xerath and wonder how he gets poked to death.

So seriously you tell me where i can find those players who have a "have a brief discussion if two people want the same thing," and let me know where that happens besides premade 5 man teams.

Because when i trust someone further down in pick order to play the lane they ask for they troll me, but if i dodge to save myself the loss and grief, i get punished. riot hates players under gold, and even gold is a stretch...

>because i never get those players who suck it up and take the out cast role.

But YOU did. You chose to be a bigger person by playing support and jungler, even in your placement games. Maybe your teammates in Bronze (let's be honest, one large reason Bronze has such a reputation is that lots of players hit level 30 and immediately play ranked without practice. None of my silver/gold friends rushed it, and it paid off) have that level of immaturity, but you didn't.

You know what that means?

Bronze players focus too much on mechanics and roles and blah blah blah, but you've been willing to take the heavy teamwork roles. You're going to climb, man, you're going to climb. We've had different experiences so far, but I honestly believe you can climb with the right attitude.

I waited to get into ranked though, my buddy had been playing long before i started and he kept me out of ranked until i had over 300 normal wins and idk how many games played. In the end it did nothing for me, we duo queued ranked, lost 8/10 placement games and i was never matched with teammates below silver, lost to teams of unranked players and bronze constantly. i got blamed and reported more then i can even recall even when i was support top would feed, then report. and i was ranked into bronze and my duo and i have both fallen to b5 with this new reset.

What did i get from being the "bigger person," jaded?

Nah, but you might have skills that non-team players don't have.

It's fine to be jaded. Hell, I'd rather be cynical than naive. But look at it this way:

1. Junglers can carry too. Usually it's better off to give kills to your laners, but you play a more active role in the entire team's progression than the support would in bot lane.
2. Supports support the entire team. After the laning phase is over, you don't have to babysit the adc 24/7. Go to whoever's fed the most and get them even more fed!

But seriously, man, everyone had to climb at some point to get to Silver. It'll take time, but you can do it.
I am glad that I'll get to play Leona every game.

Not really.
The biggest issue/flaw of TeamBuilder is  that "Find another team" button is spammable and u can press it 10000 times till u actually find a match or convenient team. That's why queues are around 20-30min. Tho I dont wanna see, "mid or troll" in any queues so im lookin forward to this ,.Yes im silver but i've seen my friend at Plat I and he still encounters those ppl
But in turn, maybe this will get more people to start learning other champs that have support "capabilities" but not necessarily a supp.  Like a naut, or alistar, or annie, or morg.  I love the idea.

A part of me agrees with you. A part of me also would rather wait for a support who wants to support rather than someone who got stuck with it and is going to try and damage carry and split push instead of actually supporting. Most games in bronze are lost because the support didn't want to play support. True story.

I'd rather have a team of people who know their roles. I mean if you lose a game because you had 3 people fight over a role then u wasted ~30mins and you lost MMR. It's the reason why I don't grind ranked.  Plus this just gives more time for netflix and porn...Though in my case I main support so they will have to be quickies.

Nothing can satisfy this community, can it? Riot releases information about a more effective way to play Ranked games and people start fussing about it and throwing out buckets of negativity. Maybe it does take a long time to find a support in normal Team Builder but complaining about it will get you nowhere. I'd much rather support someone in a Ranked game than in a Normal game. Why? I'll at least be able to play against serious opponents and with a team that might have 2 others who are serious, as opposed to a team in Normal Team Builder which will want to surrender as soon as possible. Also, maybe if teams didn't crap on Supports, they wouldn't be afraid to come out. If you want more on that topic search around on these boards, there are loads of threads with why people don't want to play Support anymore.

I think I'm one of the few people who enjoys playing Support and who actually signs up for it in Normal Team Builder, even with the crap, so you can bet your money I'll be playing Support in Ranked games, too. But not only cause I'll enjoy it, but because I'll want others to play games as well. I know Supports are hard to find in game but it's not difficult to try and play that role once in a while instead of getting upset over it. Play a game in the shoes of a Support and maybe you'll learn something.
One of my mains is support {{champion:113}} , and two of the friends I play with are support mains. I thank you for standing up for our people.

My only qualm about Team Builder and even **Ranked** Team Builder, is that Riot pigeonholed the bot lane, Marksman role, and Support role.  You can find ranged junglers, AP tops, tank mids, and so on.  But bot lane?  Always one Marksman and one Support, even if they don't do much or make the rest of the team miserable.  Your Marksman can be 0/17, and your Support can feed, but Riot WANTS you to do it nonetheless.  That, I think, is the problem.

Riot didnt do that, the pro's did. Oh its because of dragon right? ok well put dragon in the top lane...fuck now they are "pigeon holed" in top lane and bots a solo lane... there are 3 lanes and a jungle to 5 players...what exactly would you like to see happen? well you can do whatever you want, but becuase meta=player tendencies you are going to have a duo bot opposing lane so whatever you do it better be able to handle it. so put dragon in the middle of the map , lol, and the duo lane will be in mid...hell it might be 1-3-1 at that point. riot has control over the map not the players...blame the pros for finding the most efficient and winningist strategy, then blame the lemmings for following their example

Top, Mid, JG, and ADC mains - Yay we get to play our roles without arguing with people.

Support mains - "Yay, no queue times."


The only reason I can think of this maybe being a bad idea is that it gets rid of bans and counterpicking.  On the other hand, now you only need to be good with 5 champs?

I understand that some people think being good at every lane is "part of ranked" but I disagree. It is "part of ranked" because of how pick order goes not because it is intrinsically better to be a generalist. Look at any sport...if you want to get good at any team sport, you must specialize in a single position. 

I don't have time to get good at every lane and 5 champs for each lane. I will definitely play more ranked once this comes out even if queue times are much longer.
No, bans are still a thing. It'll allow you to pick your role only, not a specific champ. You get placed in a lobby with the other roles, then it drops you into champ select as usual.
Where's the post on this? I also cannot find it.
THE DREAM *cries out of joy* {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}

That is awesome!! It's about damn time they address the QoL issues of League. Being able to play the role you want, is good!

Bravo Riot!!!

They're actually going through with it? Can someone link me to the post? I'm not too worried about queue times as a support player, but there are days where I occasionally enjoy mid, top, and ad carry. I really hope I never have to jungle again in ranked.
Team Builder got ranked before Dominion.
I'm surprised they didn't have ranked team builder before.

I really don't like this. It gives players the reason to only play one role (top/mid) without knowing a thing about the others. These types of people make the **WORST** teammates. I can see it now:

-------------

Top: noob jungler never ganks
Jungler: dude, I'm Sej, the jungle hits hard, and it's only been 5 minutes into the game.  I'll get there when I can
Top: reported noob

----------

Mid: god this support never WARDS. you're a support!
Support: umm...I can only put down a max of 3 and 1 pink bro 
Mid: shutup you lowly ward slave I actually need my gold unlike you
Only comment i've read in this thread with real insight on the problems that can/will occur with this new mode.
